What If the Grade Didn't Matter?

UW is a city of learning with professors whose expertise spans a vast range of topics. Take advantage of this by choosing courses that grab your interest.

Here are some ways to match your interests to class selection:

  • What news or current events are you drawn to? What big questions keep you up at night? Identify the disciplines (tip: advisers can help!) that will help you explore these ideas.
  • Think of a faculty member who inspires you, and look at the range of courses he or she teaches. Is there a topic you would not want to miss learning about?
  • Browse the time schedule or search MyPlan for classes that look intriguing.

    • It is worth your time to take classes that compel you as they can open up new ideas and opportunities.

About the Husky Experience Toolkit

The Husky Experience Toolkit is designed to help you make the most of your time at UW, wherever you are in your university career. The articles address four interconnected dimensions of the Husky Experience: Know Yourself, Know the World, Make Your Way, and Weave it Together.
